image.altText: A serious-faced man in mining helmet looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Devastated family and friends are paying tribute to the 37-year-old father of two killed in a rockfall at the Ballarat mine, west of Melbourne.Â

title.children: Dead miner named as union accuses Ballarat Gold Mine operator of unsafe work practices

image.altText: The word Cranbrook in gold on a sandstone column at the gates of a school.

props.synopsis: As both the federal government and Cranbrook announce investigations into the prestigious boys' school, Four Corners has been inundated with new concerning allegations.

title.children: Four Corners' Cranbrook investigation saw its headmaster resign. Now new allegations are flooding in

image.altText: A composite image of George Corcoran and Cat Felmingham

props.synopsis: Sick of languishing on the public hospital waitlist for surgery, or even just an initial consultation, these Australians felt they had no choice but to take out private health cover and wait through the 12-month exclusion period.

title.children: These public health patients got sick of waiting for essential surgery and turned to the private system instead

image.altText: A medium shot of a man in a suit and tie, gesturing with his hands and speaking in front of the Australian flag.

props.synopsis: For Jim Chalmers, the prospect of delivering a second budget surplus offers more for their government's long-term than a few upset colleagues in the short-term, writes Brett Worthington.

title.children: Another budget surplus is looking increasingly likely this year, but the treasurer is warning of tough times ahead

image.altText: A rice field in Bali

props.synopsis: Two foreign tourists including an Australian woman have been killed on the Indonesian resort island of Bali after heavy rain triggered a landslide that swept away their villa, an official said on Thursday.

title.children: Australian woman killed in Bali landslide

image.altText: Lambie Network websites

props.synopsis: Senator Jacqui Lambie says she cannot believe the Liberals have "gone this far" in creating a website to attack her in the lead-up to the Tasmanian election.

title.children: 'Absolutely ropeable': Lambie slams Liberals for using domain name almost identical to her official party site

image.altText: a man in a pink shirt and blue tie standing on a suburban street

props.synopsis: The mayor of one of Australia's biggest councils is calling for an overhaul of Queensland's political donation laws after raising concerns about his potential successor's political donations.

title.children: Why an outgoing mayor has raised concerns about his potential successor's political donations

image.altText: A man stands outside a white bus surrounded by two security guards

props.synopsis: After four nights stranded by floodwaters in WA's outback Goldfields, the seven travellers have touched down in Kalgoorlie-Boulder.

title.children: Stranded travellers successfully rescued after four nights stranded in outback floods

image.altText: A man leaves a police station.

props.synopsis: A court finds former Fiji prime minister Frank Bainimarama guilty of perverting the course of justice, ordering he face sentencing later this month for interfering in police investigations.

title.children: Former Fiji PM Frank Bainimarama facing jail time after being found guilty of interfering in police investigation

image.altText: Richmond's Daniel Rioli handpasses off the ground as Carlton's Matthew Owies tries to tackle him during an AFL game.

props.synopsis: After a stunning one-point victory over the Lions in Opening Round, Carlton will look to heap more pain on Richmond after they fell to the Suns on the Gold Coast. Follow live.

title.children: Tigers lose gun defender to serious-looking injury but lead Blues by point at half time in thriller at the MCG

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: We're back for the second half
Richmond believes Gibcus has injured his ACL
Half time: Tigers lead by a point at the long break

image.altText: A man is seen bleeding from his head while emergency services are on board

props.synopsis: There are reports the sudden movement experienced on a LATAM Airlines flight to Auckland on Monday was due to the movement of a cockpit seat.

title.children: Cockpit seat movement reportedly under scrutiny after LATAM Airlines sudden drop

image.altText: President Donald Trump participates in a video teleconference call with members of the military

props.synopsis: A bill before US Congress which would force TikTok to either sell up or face a ban has breezed through its first two tests â but don't expect an actual ban any time soon.

title.children: How Trump's disgust for 'enemy of the people' Facebook could save TikTok

image.altText: A woman with a gun.

props.synopsis: Regular Israelis are taking up arms in record numbers in the wake of the October 7 attack. It's left some Palestinian citizens of Israel fearful.

title.children: Israeli mum Yamit just bought her first handgun, but her attempt to demonstrate it didn't go to plan

image.altText: Bleached coral below the waterline on the Great Barrier Reef.

props.synopsis: Scientists are split on what the outcome will be but a fifth mass bleaching event in eight years on the Great Barrier Reef is not a good sign.

title.children: Two-hundred-year-old corals are dying in mass bleaching of Great Barrier Reef

image.altText: A picture of a girl and an older woman hugging and posing for a photo

props.synopsis: Amelia Grozdanovski has been waiting more than a decade for answers about her motherÂ Lorrin's disappearance. She says the high-profile case of Ballarat woman Samantha Murphy leaves her wondering why police still haven't found her mum.

title.children: The search for Samantha Murphy has transfixed the nation. Amelia wants to know why her mum's disappearance didn't

image.altText: Machinery in a grey dirt field where a gold mine is.

props.synopsis: Kilometres of tunnel stretch beneath the city of Ballarat where a man has died in a rockfall. It's not the first incident the company has seen sparking safety concerns.Â Â

title.children: Here's what we know about Victoria's fatal rockfall at Ballarat Gold Mine

image.altText: Little Pebble arrest

props.synopsis: Sandra Mathison and her partner William "Little Pebble" Kamm were arrested earlier this week and police have accused the pair of grooming a girl for years from the age of six.

title.children: Court hears 'very chilling' allegations about 'almost lifelong' grooming of child

image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers in the corridors of Parliament House.

props.synopsis: Federal Treasurer Jim Chalmers says there will be no 'big cash splashes' in the May budget, warning a decline in iron ore prices and a softening labour market will impact the bottom line.

title.children: 'No big cash splashes' in budget but windfalls will be spent, Chalmers says

image.altText: Warren Tredrea

props.synopsis: Former Nine News Adelaide sports presenter and AFL star Warren Tredrea has lost his unfair dismissal court case against his former employer.

title.children: Warren Tredrea loses unfair dismissal case against Channel 9

image.altText: A dirty package with letters R-Z on it

props.synopsis: More than 250 kilograms of cocaine has now washed ashore on New South Wales beaches and across the border into Victoria, with police appealing for information about the packages.

title.children: Another cocaine brick washes ashore in NSW as police recover 256 kilograms since December

image.altText: A close shot of Dutton's face, partially lit.

props.synopsis: The opposition leader has called for powers to take down harmful online content to be extended to social media posts "glamorising" violence and criminal activity, with new offences to punish those who "post and boast".

title.children: Dutton pushes to criminalise social media posts 'glamorising' crime, with powers to take down content

image.altText: optus 'yes' sign on glass fronted office block

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 ended lower on Thursday, dragged down by the big four banks despite a boost in the mining sector, while Singtel has clarified speculation about selling Optus for $16 billion. Look back on the day's business and financial news as it happened with our blog.

title.children: Singtel clarifies rumours of $16 billion Optus sell-off, treasurer upbeat about economy ahead of federal budget, ASX ends lower â as it happened

image.altText: Three women and four children eat off a plate amid rubble in Rafah.

props.synopsis: Israel is planning to tell 1.4 million displaced Palestinians trapped in the southern city of Rafah to seek shelter in central Gaza ahead of a planned military offensive into the south.

title.children: Israel planning to direct 1.4m displaced Palestinians in Rafah to 'humanitarian islands' in central Gaza

image.altText: Maia Sandu poses on stairs in a grey suit jacket and skirt, looking to the side with a smile

props.synopsis: Officials in ex-Soviet Moldova say Moscow is breaking laws by printing ballot papers and opening unauthorised polling stations in the separatist region of Transdniestria ahead of this week's Russian presidential election.

title.children: Moldova says Russia illegally printed ballots for election in separatist region

image.altText: A woman holds up sign outside of Capitol Hill reading #KeepTikTok

props.synopsis: The US House of Representatives passes a bill that could spell the end of TikTok for US users. Here's what you need to know.

title.children: TikTok faces an ultimatum in the US: sell or get banned. But how did it get to here?

image.altText: A graphic showing different types of drugs overlaid on blocks.

props.synopsis: The Australian Criminal Intelligence Commission's latest wastewater drug use report sheds light on how the illicit drug market varies across the country.

title.children: Which Australian city consumes the most cocaine? A new report exposes the country's drug habits

image.altText: world's heaviest blueberry balanced on human hand

props.synopsis: A Guinness World Record-holding blueberry variety could break new ground for the fruit in Australia, according to its Mid North Coast grower.Â

title.children: Ping pong ball-sized blueberry emerges from bumper NSW yield to take world title

image.altText: a close up of OliviaÂ Munn waving, wearing a metallic halter neck dress.

props.synopsis: Munn is about 20 years younger than Australia's average age of diagnosis which, according to the Cancer Council, is 62 years old.

title.children: Actor Olivia Munn praised for raising breast cancer awareness after double mastectomy

image.altText: Gina Rinehart stands in front of advertising for an event media conference.

props.synopsis: The federal government announces a major funding package for a project that will become Australia's first combined rare earths mine and refinery, north of Alice Springs, which the government says will be vital for the nation's position in global markets.

title.children: $1b in taxpayer aid slated for Rinehart-backed rare earth mine in Central Australia

image.altText: Kim Jong Un in tank

props.synopsis: North Korean state media reports Kim Jong Un expressed "great satisfaction" after guiding a military demonstration involving a new battle tank.

title.children: Kim Jong Un 'drives' new tank during mock North Korean battle

image.altText: Side profile of Geert Wilders wearing a suit with his hair combed back

props.synopsis: Mr Wilders, whose anti-Islam, anti-immigration rhetoric swept him to victory in the November election, says he is ready to forego the job of prime minister to facilitate the formation of a new right-wing government.

title.children: Dutch politician Geert Wilders abandons PM bid to assist formation of right-wing coalition

image.altText: A covered walkway at a primary school.

props.synopsis: A 44-year-old has been charged with trespass and wilful disturbance after he allegedly made physical contact with students at a primary school.

title.children: Charges laid against alleged Sunshine Coast primary school intruder

image.altText: Olivia Rodrigo on the opening night of her GUTS World Tour. in a silver two piece

props.synopsis: Fans have applauded the move form the singer, who is contributing proceeds from her Guts tour to an abortion fund.Â

title.children: Olivia Rodrigo hands out free contraception at concert in abortion-banned state

image.altText: A film still of Katy O'Brian and Kristen Stewart sitting close together, in 80s-style outfits, on a gym floor.

props.synopsis: Love Lies Bleeding is an instant entry into the queer heart-throb canon, arriving after years of gnawing hunger for complex female antiheroes.

title.children: Blood lust meets queer heart-throb canon in this noir revenge thriller starring Kristen Stewart

image.altText: Josh Cavallo on his left knee proposing to Leighton Morrell at Hindmarsh Stadium.

props.synopsis: A-League Men player Josh Cavallo thanks Adelaide United after getting engaged to his partner on the pitch at Hindmarsh Stadium.

title.children: 'It felt right': Trailblazer Cavallo announces engagement at Adelaide United's home ground
